body: @ijuma @hachikuji This is a trivial update and actually reflects how we've been running tests. The scripts we use on Jenkins had been improperly using `pip install -U ducktape`. This meant that when I pushed out ducktape 0.6.0 it started using that. We actually want to pin to the version specified in the setup.py. I've updated Jenkins to remove the incorrect `pip` command, but now we will need to update this version -- besides a few bug fixes, this newer version added support for the `--compress` flag to compress all the output data.
LGTM
Oh, btw, I will also cherry pick to 0.10.0 and 0.10.1
Thanks @ijuma , the fix's taking more time to come than expected, I agree we should temporarily disable that.
LGTM. Thanks!
This patch is not needed because controller already has the lock when it is executing `onControllerFailover()` as of current implementation.
@ijuma @becketqin Thanks for the review. Can we merge and close this pull request?

LGTM, this is the 0.10.1 version of https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2217.

Merged, please close the PR as I can't close it myself.
@ijuma please review this PR. Thanks.
@dguy, can you please take a look?
Test passed. Weird error on jenkins: `hudson.remoting.Channel@8690f26:ubuntu-4: java.io.IOException: Remote call on ubuntu-4 failed`
sorry @ijuma and @guozhangwang - LGTM
Thanks @dguy. I was wondering if it would be better to catch that exception in `getOrCreateFileChannel`?
And do what? Retry? It would be nice if there was a test, but it is a pretty tricky thing to write a test for.
@ijuma looks like this is duplicating KAFKA-1614 (#1196) which has been stalled for a few years.
@xvrl, good point, that PR does this and more. It was the log segments metric that raised some questions in that case.
Anyway, I'll close this for now.
@hachikuji I tried that and it had little effect on the streams performance (+1MB/s or so, can't tell if it's significant).

@enothereska I loaded a single partition with 20,000,000 1K records. I used the consumer performance test. This is trunk:

|max.poll.records|throughput|
|-----------------|-----------|
|1|248.1233|
|16|513.6948|
|64|527.4310|
|65536|545.6583|

This is the results if we optimize the `pollNoWakeup()` call:

|max.poll.records|throughput|
|-----------------|-----------|
|1|394.8962|
|16|526.4992|
|64|529.6719|
|65536|537.3721|

And here is using this patch:

|max.poll.records|throughput|
|-----------------|-----------|
|1|410.0502|
|16|509.8636|
|64|528.4978|
|65536|527.4164|

There was a bit of variance in the individual tests, but it's tough to dispute the +150MB difference with max.poll.records=1 between trunk and the two alternatives on the table. My takeaways were the following:

1. Optimizing `pollNoWakeup` gets most of the benefit without changing prefetching behavior.
2. Increasing max.poll.records even a little gets you close to the maximum throughput possible.

I guess we should try to figure out why your results are coming out different.
@guozhangwang @enothereska @mjsax
@xiguantiaozhan Did you get a chance to resolve the conflicts?
Thanks for the patch. Merged to trunk.
LGTM

Test passed, weird Jenkins error happening more frequently: 
BUILD SUCCESSFUL

Total time: 1 hrs 19 mins 9.575 secs
Recording test results
Setting GRADLE_2_4_RC_2_HOME=/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/tools/hudson.plugins.gradle.GradleInstallation/Gradle_2.4-rc-2
@dguy @mjsax have a look if you can please. Thanks.

I agree It is a bit hard to write a unit test for it, and I can move the catch exception to `getOrCreateFileChannel` and return null, and let the caller function to return false when the returned value is null, but I feel it is a bit indirect in returning values. But if you have strong opinion let me know @ijuma .
The method is only used from one place, so I don't feel strongly. I didn't understand the race condition though, what file is missing causing the NSFE?
Unit test passed locally.
@dguy @mjsax if you have time.
Just a meta comment: it's better to modify the PR title to be more meaningful for the commit message moving forward.
LGTM. Merged to trunk and cherry-picked to 0.10.1.
@guozhangwang @enothereska
@ijuma minor code changes, please review.thanks.
LGTM!

I have a question about the added sensors, otherwise LGTM.

Could you add the corresponding upgrade section in docs as well? We'd encourage doing code change and doc change in a single PR so that people won't forget about them.

@junrao @ijuma I have implemented the solution described in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4485. Since this patch will change the way we measure ISR set and high watermark, it is better to get more eyes on this. Can you take a look?

@ijuma Here is my analysis: with multiple threads, it is possible that when one thread is trying to create the lock file as `dir/appId/taskId/.lock`, the parent directory `dir/appId/taskId` has been deleted by another thread, causing the NSFE. One similar issue reported is this: https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8052403 

It has less relevance with the `CREATE, WRITE` file open options. I can update the comments and merge the patch if it sounds good to you.
Sounds good to me.

Previously I was confused because the exception was thrown on the lock file itself: 

```
java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException: /data/1/kafka-streams/myapp-streams/7_21/.lock
```

But looking at the above JDK ticket it seems to be an issue of `UnixFileSystemProvider.newFileChannel` itself that the exception message directly prints the local path even if it is actually the parent directory that is missing.
@dguy I absolutely agree with your duplication concern. Unfortunately, I have no idea how we could avoid this. :(

Just a meta commend: I would revert the boolean flag and only set it as last statement with try-catch (ie, set if no exception occuered). This has the advantage that it will be set in a single place and if new catch blocks get addend, we cannot forget to set it.
Updated the pull request with the documentation, and I also fixed the stylecheck errors.
@hachikuji If 2. (increasing max.poll.records a little) gets most of the benefit, I propose we don't spend more time on this problem and close this PR.
A PR to avoid the unnecessary pollNoWakeup seems worthwhile IMO.

Hmm, seems to be failing on a different builder at the same point:

> org.apache.kafka.connect.runtime.distributed.DistributedHerderTest > testAccessors STARTED

which is weird since I don't think we've seen that before and it's a pretty straightforward test for code that I don't think has changed recently.

The other failure seems expected -- I think it's a known flaky Streams test.
